intro: Cyclamen cilicium var. intaminatum, commonly known as the Cilician cyclamen, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Turkey and Syria. It features heart-shaped, velvety leaves with a distinctive silver-pink underside, and produces clusters of pink to purple flowers in spring. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and prefers well-drained, humus-rich soil. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens and greenhouses. Cyclamen cilicium var. intaminatum is a member of the Primulaceae family, sharing characteristics with other cyclamen species.
